Webonomics 1.0 documentation

2.4. Tables and Lists

«  2.3. Images and Links   ::   Contents   ::   2.5. Text Formatting Elements  »

2.4. Tables and Lists¶

  1. Tables and Lists in the document help to organize the data in a structured way.
  2. This increases the readibility of the text and ease to understand.
  3. HTML has <table>, <ul>, <ol> lists for the same.

Let us have a look :

2.4.1. Tables¶

  1. Tables are defines with <table> tag.
  2. It is divided into table rows with the <tr> tag.
  3. Table rows are divided into table data with <td> tag.
  4. The table heading are given using <th> tag.

2.4.1.1. Syntax¶

<table>
    <tr>
            <td>...</td>
            <td>...</td>
    </td>
</table>

2.4.2. Lists¶

  1. There are following types of list -
  2. In Unordered List, the list item are marked with bullets.

2.4.2.1. Syntax¶

<ul>
      <li> ..</li>
      <li> ..</li.
</ul>
  1. You can change the style of the bullet using list-style-type attribute -

list-style-type:disc|circle|square|none

  1. In Ordered List, the list items are marked using numbers.

2.4.2.2. Syntax¶

<ol>
      <li> ..</li>
      <li> ..</li.
</ol>
  1. You can change the type using type attribute -

type="1|A|a|I|i"

  1. In Decription List, we have description of each of the item beside it.

2.4.2.3. Syntax¶

<dl>
      <dt> ..</dt>
      <dd> ........ </dd>
</dl>
  1. <dt> specifies the description term and <dd> the description of that term
  2. Below is the code which shows all the above :

<!DOCTYPE html>

<html>
<head>
<title> Tables & Lists </title>
<style>
        h1 {
                text-align:center;
        }

        a:link {
              color:green; 
        }
        a:visited {
                color:blue;
        }
        a:hover {
                color:orange;
                text-decoration:none;
        }
        a:active {
                color:magenta;
        }
</style>
</head>

<body style="background-color:cyan">
        <h1 id="top">Hello World</h1>
        <h1 style="color:blue">How</h1>
        <h1>Are</h1>
        <h1>You</h1>

        This line1 is without `p` tag.<br>
        This line2 is without `p` tag.
        <hr>
        <p> This line1 is within the tag.</p> <br> <p>This is also within the tag.</p>


        <hr style=width:560px;height:30px;color:red;background-color:red>
        <hr size="30">

        <!--To add the image -->
        <img src="../images/1.png" alt="1.png" title="sun">
        <img src="../images/1.png" alt="1.png" title="sun" style="width:100px;height=100px;">

        <br>
        <!-- To add the internal link -->
        <a href="#top"> Top </a>

        <br>
        <!-- To add external link -->
        <a href="https://www.google.co.in"> Google.com </a>

        <br><br>
        <!--Insert Table -->
        <table border="1" style="width:100%;">
                <tr>
                        <td>Column 1,1</td>
                        <td>Column 1,2</td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                        <td>Column 2,1</td>
                        <td>Column 2,2</td>
                </tr>
        </table>

        <br><br>
        <!--Insert a Unordered List -->
        <ul style="list-style-type:square">
                <li>unordered list1</li>
                <li>unordered list2</li>
        </ul>

        <!--Insert an Ordered List -->
        <ol type="I">
                <li>ordered list1</li>
                <li>ordered list2</li>
        </ol>

        <!--Description List -->
        <dl>
                <dt> Term 1 </dt>
                <dd> description1 <dd>
        </dl>
</body>
</html>
  1. Example Link example08
